qas.question: What is a university formed through a bilateral treaty known as?
In terms of intergovernmental universities, what is EUCLID?
What is a mission of EUCLID as it relates to signatory nations?
What type of school is the European University Institute?
What type of study does the European University Institute focus on?
What is a university formed through a unilateral treaty known as?
What is a mission of EUCLID as it relates to the United Nations?
What type of school is the EUCLID?
What type of study does the EUCUD focus on?
What offers training in Asian law?

context: Universities created by bilateral or multilateral treaties between states are <a0_0><b5_0>intergovernmental<b5_0/><a0_0/>. An example is the <b9_0>Academy of European Law<b9_0/>, which offers training in European law to lawyers, judges, barristers, solicitors, in-house counsel and academics. EUCLID (<a1_0>Pôle Universitaire Euclide, Euclid University<a1_0/>) is chartered as a university and umbrella organisation dedicated to <a2_0><b6_0>sustainable development<b6_0/><a2_0/> in signatory countries, and the United Nations University engages in efforts to resolve the pressing global problems that are of concern to the United Nations, its peoples and member states. The European University Institute, a <a3_0><b7_0>post-graduate<b7_0/><a3_0/> university specialised in the <a4_0><b8_0>social sciences<b8_0/><a4_0/>, is officially an intergovernmental organisation, set up by the member states of the European Union.
